section.p: The configsettings_controller.properties file located in <install_pack_dir>/databases/app_db contains the configuration settings for the ROR service controller. This configuration is used for the initial setup and stored in the APP database.

section.title: CONTROLLER_ID
section.p: The identifier of the service controller.

section.title: IAAS_API_LOCALE
section.p: The locale to be used for accessing ROR.
Replace <locale> with the identifier of the desired locale, for example, en or ja.

section.title: IAAS_API_PWD
section.p: The password of the user for accessing the tenant in ROR.
Replace <password> with the plain text password which is valid for the user given in IAAS_API_USER. The password is encrypted when it is stored in the database.

section.title: IAAS_API_TENANT
section.p: The identifier of the tenant for your organization in ROR.

section.title: IAAS_API_URI
section.p: The URL of the ROR API.
Replace <ROR server> and <port> with the host name and port of your ROR server.

section.title: IAAS_API_USER
section.p: The user ID to be used to access the tenant for your organization in ROR. The user must have the necessary credentials to create and configure virtual platforms and servers for the tenant. This means that he must have the role of a tenant administrator.

section.title: BSS_ORGANIZATION_ID
section.p: The ID of the organization in which is responsible for the service controller. The organization must have the technology provider role.

section.title: BSS_USER_KEY
section.p: Replace <userKey> with the user key which you receive with the confirmation email for your user account.
The user specified here must have the technology manager role in and belong to the organization specified in the BSS_ORGANIZATION_ID setting.
It is recommended that the user account is used only for carrying out actions on behalf of the service controller in .

section.title: BSS_USER_ID
section.p: The identifier of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .

section.title: BSS_USER_PWD
section.p: The password of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .
Replace <password> with the plain text password. The password is encrypted when it is stored in the database.
